Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my mother, she needs good battery (talk time) this seems best choice (1750 mAh of battery capacity, Up to 10 hours of talk time, Up to 560 hours of standby time), and it's cheap. I turn off all unnecessary apps (extras) and battery now holds very good charge. Nice display, Wi-Fi, bluetooth, good screen response, pretty fast, Sim card included this is big plus. Camera is ok, no flash though. SD card slot. This phone is locked only will work with metroPCS.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good phone for the price
Reviews.Author: Shaneatha
Reviews.Content: Huawei valiant is stocked good with a nice processor, good battery life, screen size and pixels. The size is decent too. The shape reminds me of the iPhone just not as slick.Cons-camera sucks-No portable WiFiI fixed the portable WiFi problem w/an app called (portable WiFi) now I can connect my Kindle fire hd and laptop :)Take pictures in the sun light and you'll be okay!I also downloaded sms(to enhance text experience w/ emojis)PlusAdded Go launcher to change the screen, apps and lock screenLooks like a brand new phone :)

Reviews.Title: Solid performer in a 3G phone
Reviews.Author: rdk
Reviews.Content: Not the newest model, but if you don't care about that, it's plenty fast, long battery life, and very reliable as phone and Android device. Almost never even a minor hiccup. Even the hotspot works OK for a fraction of the cost of iPad data service. (Much better than the LG smartphone I used before.)

Reviews.Title: Okay Phone For $29 At MetroPCS
Reviews.Author: Alan  Houston
Reviews.Content: The Valiant is a very basic and cheaply made smartphone. But, MetroPcs sells it for just $29 at the Metro website and neighborhood MetroPcs stores. It runs on T-Mobile's 3G network, which is strong in most large cities and in some smaller cities.  Use the coverage map at the MetroPcs website to verify coverage in your neighborhood BEFORE you buy a MetroPcs phone.The Valiant is fine for calls and texting. Its tiny internal memory makes it a bad choice for gamers and folks who want to install dozens of apps. You must add a memory card to store your music and photos.The camera is useless indoors but takes okay photos in bright sunlight.  Music sounds poor through the rear speaker but fine through headphones or a Bluetooth speaker.Bottom Line: the Valiant will let you make phone calls and send texts on the bargain $40 a month unlimited plan from MetroPcs.  If you lose it or drop it, you are out $29.  THIS is the phone to take on your next canoe trip or hiking adventure, not a $600 phone named after fruit.

Reviews.Title: Incredible Value
Reviews.Author: Cecil B
Reviews.Content: Pros:Costs as little as $19.99Dual Core CPUGood Battery LifeNice DisplayCons: Will not Play COD GhostsNo Flash on the cameraNo Front CameraI will attempt to practice Brevity on this review.The phone comes with 4GB of storage, 2GB is dedicated to the OS. This means that you have to either be very selective in what apps you install, or be proactive on deleting apps that you aren't using. It has a removable battery and SD Slot, so there is no problem with putting all the media you want on it.The phone has a dual core CPU and 768MB of RAM, and performs the way you would expect a phone with those specs to perform, snappy and responsive. This is where budget phones tend to fail, they often still come with single core CPU and 512MB or less of RAM, and get bogged down quickly, this phone doesn't have that problem. It runs apps flawlessly that I have seen more expensive phones with similar specs fail to run at all.I haven't attempted to root this phone, but I did unlock it. I bought the unlock code via Ebay for $3. I paid $29.99 for the phone directly from Metro PCS (it is currently available from Metro for $19.99 with no rebates), that makes less than $33 for an unlocked 3G GSM phone that is a decent performer.I have used and worked on a lot of cell phones over the years, I can't think of any available for close to this price that hold a candle to this phone. I will be buying a couple more at $19.99 , I will unlock them, and stick them in a drawer as spares, so when family member break their S3, Nexus and LG G2 phones, we will have a capable backup until their better phone can be replaced.This phone is perfect for novice users who don't want to invest much into a smartphone while they decide if it is right for them (most smartphones in the price range are tough on beginners because they so underpowered), it is also great for more advanced users to keep around as a backup or to carry in situations where the fear losing or breaking a more expensive phone. It won't keep an advanced user completely satisfied, but it will keep them going in that several day period between losing the old phone and getting the new one.

Reviews.Title: iPhone is a massive ripoff
Reviews.Author: S. Kolinjavadi "skolin"
Reviews.Content: When I saw this phone going for $29 and change I decided to try it, and it opened my eyes to how much more of a rip off the iPhone is than you already think it is. Yeah iOS is slick,  the iPhone feels better made, but its not 20 times or more better to support the price you pay for it. While short on space its nothing qn SD card mini wont cure. Its the smart phone for smart people,im planning to sell the iphone it has now replaced.

Reviews.Title: Gift
Reviews.Author: Consuila Harris
Reviews.Content: My mom loves this phone!!! Its simple and easy for her to work on her own with no problem! Awesome!

Reviews.Title: nice for the price
Reviews.Author: V
Reviews.Content: ok so I recently bought one Valiant at my local MetroPCS store, the price I paid with activation was somewhat steep.  My wife liked it and wanted one and knowing I usually find better prices on Amazon I looked here, at the time I think the price was 63.00 bucks AND once we recieved it and got it activated (17 dollars) at our local store the total was STILL less than I paid and we still had a bit of scratch left to get a hybrid gel case and screen protection. . . . of course I got both here, LOL.So now we are ordering some for the kids.

Reviews.Title: stopped charging
Reviews.Author: Maura Murcko
Reviews.Content: bought this for my daughter for Christmas. Having problems with it charging on and off all week. Going to try to exchange.

Reviews.Title: Bottom Barrel is not so bad...
Reviews.Author: BruinTechie
Reviews.Content: Got one to play around with and have been very impressed with this low end wonder.  It is is not a S5, but for less than you'd probably spend a month on service, it will do all the basics without much complaint (except for maybe the camera).  Huawei UI mods aren't horrendous and bloatware is not too bad.Bottom line: It's not art, but it'll do.Pros:Handles basic smartphone tasks solidly.Expandable memory and removable battery(If you take it out of the country first) cheap 3rd party carrier unlocks.Cons:There are low end phones with better cameras.Very little 3rd party mod support.Final Thought: Waiting until we see this level of subsidy on a Moto G.

Reviews.Title: Hi
Reviews.Author: ruben
Reviews.Content: Thus phone runs really good and she loves it so for now she gets this one maybe I get one to.

Reviews.Title: Love this phone
Reviews.Author: richman
Reviews.Content: It's a cheap mp3 player with built in speaker that is loud.It's an ebook reader.It's a wifi device for surfing the web.It plays netflix, pandora, youtube.It has OFFline gps for driving or walkingIt's an emergence 911 phone even without activation.It's can make regular phone calls and receive them.It's a calculator, alarm clock, plays games.I mean if you want to pay 400 dollars for a device that does the same things you can, but , this is good enough for me. For cheap.

Reviews.Title: i would say you got a winner there
Reviews.Author: steve
Reviews.Content: it is one of the best new phones I have ever bought.an the ease of use of the is fanstincks

Reviews.Title: great buy
Reviews.Author: ccb
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with all the extra widgets and the voice controls, very easy to learn how this phone works

Reviews.Title: was a gift
Reviews.Author: Alexander
Reviews.Content: was a gift for my nephew and he loves it and it serves his needs just fine with no complaints

Reviews.Title: Great deal
Reviews.Author: Rory Cockerline
Reviews.Content: This phone is less than half the price as the one you can from metro pcs and gets better reception than metros.
